quiz.title: Quantitative Reasoning Beginner to Intermediate Quiz

questions.text: What is the value of 15% of 200?
If a car travels 240 km in 4 hours, what is its speed in km/h?
questions.explanation: Speed = Distance ÷ Time = 240 km ÷ 4 hours = 60 km/h.

questions.text: Solve for x: 2x + 5 = 13
questions.explanation: Subtract 5 from both sides: 2x = 13 - 5 = 8. Divide by 2: x = 8 ÷ 2 = 4.

questions.text: What is the area of a rectangle with length 8 cm and width 5 cm?
questions.explanation: Area of a rectangle = length × width = 8 × 5 = 40 cm².

questions.text: If the ratio of boys to girls in a class is 3:2 and there are 30 students, how many boys are there?
questions.explanation: The ratio 3:2 means 3 parts boys, 2 parts girls, total 5 parts. Each part = 30 ÷ 5 = 6 students. Boys = 3 × 6 = 18.

questions.text: What is the simple interest on $1000 at 5% per annum for 2 years?
questions.explanation: Simple Interest = (Principal × Rate × Time) ÷ 100 = (1000 × 5 × 2) ÷ 100 = $100.

questions.text: If 4 workers can complete a job in 12 days, how many days will 6 workers take?
questions.explanation: Total work = 4 workers × 12 days = 48 worker-days. With 6 workers, days = 48 ÷ 6 = 8 days.

questions.text: What is the value of 2³ × 3²?
questions.explanation: Calculate 2³ = 8 and 3² = 9. Then, 8 × 9 = 72.

questions.text: A shirt costs $40 after a 20% discount. What was the original price?
questions.explanation: Let original price = x. After 20% discount, price = 80% of x = 0.8x = 40. Solve: x = 40 ÷ 0.8 = 50.

questions.text: What is the perimeter of a square with side length 7 cm?
questions.explanation: Perimeter of a square = 4 × side length = 4 × 7 = 28 cm.

questions.text: If x + y = 10 and x - y = 4, what is the value of x?
questions.explanation: Add the equations: (x + y) + (x - y) = 10 + 4 → 2x = 14 → x = 7.

questions.text: A train travels 300 km in 5 hours. How far will it travel in 3 hours at the same speed?
questions.explanation: Speed = 300 ÷ 5 = 60 km/h. Distance in 3 hours = 60 × 3 = 180 km.

questions.text: What is the probability of rolling a 3 on a fair six-sided die?
questions.explanation: A fair die has 6 equally likely outcomes. Probability of rolling a 3 = 1 ÷ 6 = 1/6.

questions.text: If a shop offers a 25% discount on a $80 item, what is the sale price?
What is the value of (4!)?
If the sum of two numbers is 20 and their difference is 8, what is the smaller number?
questions.explanation: Let the numbers be x and y, x + y = 20, x - y = 8. Solve: x = 14, y = 6. The smaller number is 6.

questions.text: What is the area of a circle with radius 3 cm? (Use π ≈ 3.14)
questions.explanation: Area of a circle = πr² = 3.14 × 3² = 3.14 × 9 = 28.26 cm².

questions.text: If 3 pens and 2 pencils cost $13, and 2 pens and 3 pencils cost $12, what is the cost of one pen?
questions.explanation: Let pen = P, pencil = C. Equations: 3P + 2C = 13, 2P + 3C = 12. Solve: P = 4.

questions.text: What is the next number in the sequence: 1, 3, 6, 10, 15, __?
questions.explanation: The sequence represents triangular numbers: 1, 1+2=3, 1+2+3=6, etc. The next term is 15+6=21.

questions.text: If a boat travels 60 km downstream in 3 hours, what is the speed of the boat in still water if the stream speed is 5 km/h?
questions.explanation: Downstream speed = 60 ÷ 3 = 20 km/h. Boat speed = Downstream speed - Stream speed = 20 - 5 = 15 km/h.

questions.text: What is the value of 25% of 1/4 of 80?
If a man can do a job in 15 days, how many days will it take for 3 men to do the same job?
questions.explanation: Work rate of 1 man = 1/15 job/day. For 3 men, rate = 3/15 = 1/5 job/day. Time = 1 ÷ (1/5) = 5 days.

questions.text: What is the volume of a cube with side length 4 cm?
questions.explanation: Volume of a cube = side³ = 4³ = 64 cm³.

questions.text: If a:b = 2:3 and b:c = 4:5, what is the ratio a:c?
questions.explanation: Align ratios by making b common. a:b = 2:3, b:c = 4:5 → a:b = 8:12, b:c = 12:15. Thus, a:c = 8:15.

questions.text: What is the probability of drawing a red card from a standard deck of 52 cards?
questions.explanation: A deck has 26 red cards (hearts and diamonds). Probability = 26 ÷ 52 = 1/2.

questions.text: If 5x - 3 = 12, what is the value of x?
questions.explanation: Add 3 to both sides: 5x = 15. Divide by 5: x = 15 ÷ 5 = 3.

questions.text: What is the compound interest on $2000 at 10% per annum for 1 year, compounded annually?
What is the next number in the sequence: 2, 5, 11, 23, __?
questions.explanation: The sequence follows the pattern: multiply by 2 and add 1. 2×2+1=5, 5×2+1=11, 11×2+1=23, 23×2+1=47.

questions.text: If a bicycle’s wheel has a diameter of 70 cm, how far will it travel in 10 revolutions? (Use π ≈ 3.14)
questions.explanation: Circumference = π × diameter = 3.14 × 70 ≈ 219.8 cm. Distance for 10 revolutions = 219.8 × 10 = 2198 cm.

questions.text: If 2/3 of a number is 18, what is the number?
questions.explanation: Let the number be x. Then, (2/3)x = 18. Solve: x = 18 × (3/2) = 27.

questions.text: What is the average of the numbers 10, 20, 30, 40, 50?
If a tank is filled by a pipe in 6 hours, how long will it take for 3 such pipes to fill the tank?
questions.explanation: One pipe’s rate = 1/6 tank/hour. Three pipes’ rate = 3/6 = 1/2 tank/hour. Time = 1 ÷ (1/2) = 2 hours.

questions.text: What is the sum of the interior angles of a pentagon?
questions.explanation: Sum of interior angles of a polygon = (n-2) × 180°. For a pentagon (n=5), sum = (5-2) × 180 = 540°.

questions.text: If a number is increased by 20% and then decreased by 20%, what is the net percentage change?
questions.explanation: Let the number be 100. Increase by 20%: 100 × 1.2 = 120. Decrease by 20%: 120 × 0.8 = 96. Net change = (96-100)/100 = -4%.

questions.text: What is the least common multiple (LCM) of 6 and 8?
questions.explanation: LCM is found by prime factorization: 6 = 2 × 3, 8 = 2³. LCM = 2³ × 3 = 24.

questions.text: If a bag contains 3 red and 2 blue balls, what is the probability of drawing a red ball?
questions.explanation: Total balls = 3 + 2 = 5. Probability of red = 3 ÷ 5 = 3/5.

questions.text: What is the value of √(16 + 9)?
questions.explanation: Calculate inside the root: 16 + 9 = 25. Then, √25 = 5.

questions.text: If a clock shows 3:00 now, what time will it show after 150 minutes?
questions.explanation: 150 minutes = 2 hours 30 minutes. From 3:00, add 2 hours to get 5:00, then add 30 minutes to get 5:30.

questions.text: What is the median of the numbers: 4, 7, 2, 9, 5?
questions.explanation: Sort the numbers: 2, 4, 5, 7, 9. The median is the middle number, which is 5.

questions.text: If a sum of money doubles in 4 years at simple interest, what is the annual interest rate?
questions.explanation: Let principal = P. Interest = 2P - P = P. Simple Interest = PRT/100. So, P = (P × R × 4)/100 → R = 25%.
